definitions: To put money into financial schemes, shares, property, or a commercial venture with the expectation of achieving a profit.
To devote one's time, effort, or energy to a particular undertaking with the expectation of a worthwhile result.
To provide someone with a quality or attribute.
To formally give someone power or authority.
examples: She decided to invest in real estate.
He invested a lot of time in his studies.
Nature invested the scene with beauty.
The queen will invest him with full powers.
